hobby.message: What's your last origami fold say?
Urban exploration still your kind of therapy?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me - In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: No trouble, but I took the long way to stay out of sight.
Been poking around the city's veins, utility tunnels, and such.
Just seeing how things tick underground, you know?
Noticed some extra eyes around since the news about Halden; a bit unusual.
Figure it's better to stay cautious with eyes out and about.
No, managed just fine.
Spent some time exploring the underbelly of the city, utility tunnels and old nodes.
You'd be surprised what you can find if you're curious enough.
Place had more security than usual; probably the Halden situation.
I just keep to my own paths; don't want surprises.
Arrived in one piece, I guess.
You know me, always nosing around those utility tunnels.
It’s just a hobby, finding the city’s hidden nooks.
A lot more security checks recently, perhaps due to Halden's passing.
Keeps the exploration lively, to say the least.
Nah, not much trouble at all.
Was on one of my usual runs through the utility tunnels earlier.
It's quite the hobby for me, finding old paths and network nodes.
Spotted more security guards around lately, likely due to Halden's dying.
It's made my trips more...entertaining, but hey, it adds an element of fun.
Nope, made it here smooth and easy, Alex.
Spent the day diving into some old tunnels, part of my exploration hobby.
Exploring these utility passages, you sometimes find forgotten network nodes.
With Halden's death, the city's ramped up security - makes it more thrilling.
Didn’t find much except logs that were crawling at a snail’s pace.
It’s like a treasure hunt with a twist!
hobby_answer: Urban exploration or drinking underground, huh? Well, I prefer the quiet tunnels of Stenograd, away from watchful eyes.
You never know when those cameras are on, even in the places they say they're not.
Halden's death stirred up some chatter, but I keep my hobbies close to the chest.
Exploring those tunnels is something to do when you're your own company, you understand?
Urban exploration, mostly. Helps avoid crowded places.
Took a stroll near Tower 9 recently. Bit busier than usual after Halden's exit.
Halden's got the whole system glitching; makes the tunnels feel... different.
More security sweeps now, makes an explorer keep a low profile.
Urban exploration or drinking underground? Both really; they go hand in hand.
Halden's death has changed the feel beneath the city; more eyes watching now.
Exploring the tunnels isn’t just about the thrill anymore; it’s predicting what’s next.
Found an old network node the other day; the sluggish systems make it tricky.
Makes you wonder what else is coming after Halden's final act...
Urban exploration, in case you didn’t hear that last bit.
Halden's gone, and the BCI’s a mess, even underground systems feel off.
I stumbled on a forgotten node recently — it was pretty telling, considering the logs.
With the way things have been, I've had to drink less and focus more down there.
Funny what you discover when the city’s eyes are somewhere else.
Urban exploration! More often than not paired with a drink.
After Halden’s abrupt departure, I've found myself in the tunnels more often.
His leaving left the system in chaos; even the underground doesn't feel the same.
Stumbled across some unguarded data the other day. The logs spoke volumes, friend.
Surprising what you can find when no one's minding the store, so to speak.
Guess after a few late nights down there, the city's secrets start to spill out.
